Fetch Outturn and OBR forecast of inflation measures

Source: R/get_infl.R
get_infl.Rd

Fetch Outturn and OBR forecast of inflation measures

get_infl(infl_measure, base_year = 2020, add_yrs = 30, lng_run = NULL)

Arguments

infl_measure

Inflation measure; "CPI", "RPI" or "Deflator"
base_year

Base year for indexing
add_yrs

Number of additional years in series
lng_run

Long-run rate, unless specified defaults to be 2% for CPI and GDP Deflator and 3% for RPI

Value

A data.frame containing an inflation series

Examples

get_infl("CPI", base_year = 2020, add_yrs = 0, lng_run = 2)

#> # A tibble: 16 x 4
#>     year   perc index index_2020
#>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>
#>  1  2009 2.17    1         0.792
#>  2  2010 3.30    1.03      0.818
#>  3  2011 4.46    1.08      0.854
#>  4  2012 2.83    1.11      0.879
#>  5  2013 2.56    1.14      0.901
#>  6  2014 1.46    1.15      0.914
#>  7  2015 0.0401  1.16      0.915
#>  8  2016 0.660   1.16      0.921
#>  9  2017 2.68    1.19      0.945
#> 10  2018 2.48    1.22      0.969
#> 11  2019 1.79    1.25      0.986
#> 12  2020 1.41    1.26      1    
#> 13  2021 1.80    1.29      1.02 
#> 14  2022 2.06    1.31      1.04 
#> 15  2023 2.05    1.34      1.06 
#> 16  2024 2.02    1.37      1.08
